chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Brewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

case called at 1:04pm. [MK]
Defendant Curtis  Brewer in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.  DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance. 
Mr. Brewer makes a statement.

On Count # 2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Brewer on Probation for three years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and comply with all recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with Shari Sukow
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay restitution of $50 to the Waukesha State Bank
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
-to comply with DNA sample provision upon request 
--to pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $30 summons fee

Days credit for time already served:  0 days
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given
Contact prohibition warnings penalties given
recess 1:19pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
With JI's attached.
Scheduling Notice
Criminal Case Settlement

case called at 2:41pm. 
Defendant Curtis Brewer in court with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case was scheduled for hearing on the State's Motion to Admit Other Acts today, however Attorney Zarwell indicates that Mr. Brewer is prepared to enter a change of plea.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; the elements of Party to A Crime are reviewed; a plea of " No Contest " is entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Brewer guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 & #3. 
The Court grants the request of the Defense to schedule sentencing on a later date.
recess 2:50pm.

NEXT:  Sentencing on 12/5/14 at 1:00pm  [clerk's note: this date/time was scheduled so that Mr. Brewer's transport person can bring Mr. Brewer to Jefferson after the Prelim in a Waukesha County case set for 10:00am that same day concludes]
Jury trial on November 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

case called at 1:39pm. 
Defendant Curtis T Brewer in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Mr. Brewer indicates that he does not have a middle initial.
ADA Hall asks that, rather than the listed name being altered in the case caption, that the name without the middle initial be added as an "A/K/A";  this is because the entirety of Mr. Brewer's criminal record shows the name with the middle initial "T".  
Mr. Brewer verifies that the address on the Criminal Complaint is current. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.  Mr. Brewer indicates that he will go to the PD Office this afternoon-- he intends to seek representation by counsel.
Constitutional rights are given
When Mr. Brewer expresses hesitance about whether or not to waive Preliminary Hearing time limits, the Court indicates that it will schedule a Preliminary Hearing within the 20 day time limit.

The Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no direct or indirect contact with Shari Sukow
--no acts or threats of violence
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 1:43pm. 

NEXT:  schedule Preliminary Hearing within twenty days, but as far out within that time limit as possible
